intro: Ervatamia calyculata, commonly known as the desert star or desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb with fleshy, succulent stems and leaves that help it conserve water in harsh environments. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Ervatamia calyculata is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
